org.tair.sql.expression
Interface ISingleParameterExpression<P>

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the single parameter value
All Superinterfaces:
IExpression
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSingleParameterExpression, BigDecimalParameterExpression, BigIntegerParameterExpression, BooleanParameterExpression, IntegerParameterExpression, StringParameterExpression, TimestampParameterExpression
public interface ISingleParameterExpression<P>
extends IExpression

A SQL expression suitable for use in a SELECT list or as a value expression in a WHERE clause, GROUP BY clause, or ORDER BY clause; the expression may include a single parameter or may be just a parameter itself; the expression always evaluates to a single value of type P

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Method Summary
 int bind(java.sql.PreparedStatement stmt, int index)
          Bind the value to the expression parameter ? within the prepared statement using the correct JDBC binding method for the type; the concrete instantiation of the template implements this method.
 P getParameterValue()
          Get the current value of the parameter, if any.
 void setParameterValue(P value)
          Set the value of the parameter.
 
Methods inherited from interface org.tair.sql.expression.IExpression
getExpression, getLexicalVariables, getSql, getVariable, setVariable
 

Method Detail

bind

int bind(java.sql.PreparedStatement stmt,
         int index)
         throws java.sql.SQLException
Bind the value to the expression parameter ? within the prepared statement using the correct JDBC binding method for the type; the concrete instantiation of the template implements this method.

Parameters:
stmt - the JDBC prepared statement to which to bind the parameter value
index - the parameter index of the parameter (?) to which to bind the value
Returns:
the parameter index of the next value to bind
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem binding the value to the parameter through JDBC

getParameterValue

P getParameterValue()
Get the current value of the parameter, if any.

Returns:
the value of type P

setParameterValue

void setParameterValue(P value)
Set the value of the parameter. This method does not bind the value to a SQL statement but rather just places the value into the class for later binding with the bind method.

Parameters:
value - the value of type P
